body:
LGTM 

Thanks @jimshalo10 :)
Thanks again :)
this fixes the spelling error in en-US.js
Thanks again :)
All conflicts fixed at my end so should be easy to merge thanks
Thanks for your great effort

Yes Database is downloaded empty so every one add his stories.
Do you suggest to add sample story in DB? 
Or should i add a concrete example here in documentation?

Initially code works better if there is an example story for people to look at. We developers focus so much on the code and functionality that we forget new developers need to start with a template example
I would add a concrete sample in the documentation which can be used to populate the database, this makes developers thinks about the setting up of the new story

When a concrete sample in the documentation which can be used to populate the database, then spelling grammar can be checked and amended. Then maybe we can develop extra tools for making and testing individual new stories
I added a sample story with one part. Please check and tell me what you think

Investigating Text Adventure sample [skill]( https://github.com/alexa/skill-sample-nodejs-adventure-game) there is example [stories](https://github.com/alexa/skill-sample-nodejs-adventure-game/blob/master/lambda/custom/Escape%20the%20Office.html) in  _./lambda/custom_  directory
The [skill]( https://github.com/alexa/skill-sample-nodejs-adventure-game) builds and works with the Alexa Echo, the testing function of the Alexa Development console and [ASK-Cli console](https://developer.amazon.com/docs/smapi/quick-start-alexa-skills-kit-command-line-interface.html) as described in the [skill]( https://github.com/alexa/skill-sample-nodejs-adventure-game)  [Readme.md](https://github.com/alexa/skill-sample-nodejs-adventure-game/blob/master/README.md)

>           I added a sample story with one part. Please check and tell me what you think
The update looks great, the whole story is loaded, cannot see any spelling or grammar errors.
the  "largeImageUrl", posed a problem as we didn't have any graphic content of Miriam, so we do now its in the debugextras/"who is Miriam a 11 year old female warrior character create using Unreal Game Engine AI" has  a shortened name for coding use  debugextras/WhoAmIMiriam.jpg

>           I added a sample story with one part. Please check and tell me what you think
More Requests received for Miriam's Bibliography so now a new file [MiriamREADME.md](https://github.com/jimshalo10/AlexaSamTemplate/blob/master/debugextras/MiriamREADME.md)  has been made about her lift. If you read you will see a subtle twist!
Amazing work :)
There are real problems with npm update 2.0 which need further investigation. DO NOT USE

![screenshot 5](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18351781/47622995-940c0280-db03-11e8-9bb9-312886f7fd03.png)
When you look at this from amazon.co.uk it not the  UK "Supported Languages 
English (US) "
https://www.amazon.com/Mohamed-Hassan-AbdulRahman-Play-Mariam/dp/B077YSXGMT
Sure I'll submit it for UK market but this will need some time :)

Thanks dont make it a priority, every app submitted from the UK must have US support, well submit the original US version as certification likes all versions across the world to be the same. 
If its to difficult dont bother as I not sure the size of the market in UK
Thanks for your feedback. Issue fixed now. Please try again
Thanks for your feedback. Issue fixed now. Please try again

Mohamad,

Thank you so much for writing back.

Can you please be a little more specific. Does the template create the databases, or do I create them manually as in the instructions?

You also might think about adding a line in the instructions about what to do if the Deploy process fails. From my understanding one has to go to Cloud Formation and delete the stack? Is it possible for the template to delete the stack if it fails? My reading wasn't so clear on that because I'm a complete beginner to this process.

Also if you could briefly describe your toolchain (Eclipse? - something else? or you just program in AWS editor?) that would help me out a lot getting going.

Thanks much,

Paul

I pasted in the json input into the test console and got this 

Response:
{
  "errorMessage": "Cannot find module '/var/task/index'",
  "errorType": "Error",
  "stackTrace": []
}

Also when I open my lambda function - the editor asks me for an index.js file. Is this required or needed now? Maybe a version change thing?
Lambda section & DB section is needed in case you want to create tables manually.
Skill name in instruction is correct now. Thanks for your support:)
You are totally correct. I just fix this error
Ok i figured the issue and working on it now.
check now
